hints.content: Remember, we are looking for the number of *unique* casts since we don't care about the order they are chosen.

We have $5$ options for the first robot we cast, leaving $4$ options for the second robot.

$5 \times 4 = 20$

So there are $20$ combinations. However some of these combinations involve the same set of robots.
Since the cast has $2$ members, each cast can be arranged in $2$ different ways.

question.content:
You need to cast $2$ robots for a scene and you have $5$ robots to pick from:

![5 robots](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/4721b8c9daa8bb2953c3a35cff09d46ab7ff768c.png)

How many different ways can you cast this scene?  [[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]]
